central.name: Front Range
central.description: Colorado's easternmost mountain wall extending from Wyoming to New Mexico, featuring numerous fourteeners and the Denver metropolitan area's backdrop

central.name: Sawatch Range
central.description: Colorado's highest mountain range containing 15 peaks over 14,000 feet, including the state's two highest summits

central.name: Elk Mountains
central.description: Colorado range featuring dramatic fourteeners and the famous Maroon Bells

central.name: Wasatch Mountains
central.description: Major north-south mountain range in Utah, extending from Idaho border to central Utah, forming the backbone of the Wasatch Front

central.name: Uinta Mountains
central.description: East-west trending range in northeastern Utah and northwestern Colorado, containing Utah's highest peak

central.name: Tenmile Range
central.description: Colorado range between Breckenridge and Copper Mountain, featuring several peaks over 13,000 feet

central.name: Terryall Mountains

central.description: Volcanic range in west-central Colorado featuring the West Elk Wilderness and distinctive volcanic peaks

central.name: Rabbit Ears Mountains

central.description: Distinctive flat-topped plateau in northwestern Colorado, featuring the Flat Tops Wilderness and unique geology
